Articles.Content:
Okay, so first of all, THIS is what a rocket (or shuttle, or whatever) should sound like: (go at 1:45)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gtrB9bELGSY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

This is badass, this is cool, this gives you the feeling that 2000 tons of metal are getting lifted from the ground by even more metal spitting blazing flames from hell at tremendous speeds ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

...

Seriously now, I was wondering if there was an up to date mod for 1.0.2 that replaced the boring sounds of the original KSP by new, ground-shaking, more realistic sound for engines.

I've done a little bit of research on the forums but the only few sound mods that I found for rocket engines are all out of date and their development abandoned.

Does anyone know a good sound mod for 1.0.2 or is developing / planning one ?

> 
> Seriously now, I was wondering if there was an up to date mod for 1.0.2 that replaced the boring sounds of the original KSP by new, ground-shaking, more realistic sound for engines.

[KWRocketry](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51037-0-25-KW-Rocketry-v2-6d2-Available-0-25-Compatibility!-16-10-2014) has significantly more awesome engine sounds. I might be able to get a MM patch that will let the stock engines use KW sounds; I'll look at it later this week if I have time.
there was an audio overhaul project underway back around 0.23 but it hasn't kept up with the times from what I remember. Could be wrong tho

> 
> [KWRocketry](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51037-0-25-KW-Rocketry-v2-6d2-Available-0-25-Compatibility!-16-10-2014) has significantly more awesome engine sounds. I might be able to get a MM patch that will let the stock engines use KW sounds; I'll look at it later this week if I have time.

Yeah, I know about KW rocketry but having sounds for stock rockets would be really great. Thanks for looking !

> 
> there was an audio overhaul project underway back around 0.23 but it hasn't kept up with the times from what I remember. Could be wrong tho

I saw that one, but latest version is for 0.23.5 unfortunately
